title: BMW - is it custom?
content:
I searched but search gave me no results.

[http://bmw-motorsport.com/teaser/ms/en/images/t1\_wtcc\_kundensport.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172602/http:/bmw-motorsport.com/teaser/ms/en/images/t1_wtcc_kundensport.jpg "http://bmw-motorsport.com/teaser/ms/en/images/t1\_wtcc\_kundensport.jpg")

thanks

 [‹ powell peralta skateboard label —what font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172602/http:/typophile.com/node/33918 "Go to previous forum topic") [Hand lettered "Biscotti" - What font is similar? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172602/http:/typophile.com/node/33854 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ravel

comments.content: The BMW- and the Mini-typefaces are custom. I worked with them once and downloaded them directly from BMW. Don’t know who did them or what they are based on.

The type face is called BMW Helvetica... designed to avoid those pesky licensing fees from Lino.

Mikey
